svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Diarrheal disease death rates vs. access to sanitation, 2015
Diarrheal disease death rates, measured per 100,000 individuals versus the percentage of the total population with
access to improved sanitation facilities. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush (to piped sewer system,
septic tank, pit latrine), ventilated improved pit (VIP) latrine, pit latrine with slab, and composting toilet.
Improved sanitation facilities (% of population with access)
Source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (GBD), World Bank – WDI
